name: metharbital
content: Metharbital was patented in 1905 by Emil Fischer working for Merck. It was marketed as Gemonil by Abbott Laboratories. It is a barbiturate anticonvulsant, used in the treatment of epilepsy. It has similar properties to phenobarbital.   == History == 1952 Gemonil was introduced by Abbott Laboratories. 1990 Abbott stopped marketing.   == Synthesis == Metharbital can be synthesized from 2,2-diethylmalonic acid and O-methylisourea.   == References ==
